summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and alleges she lied under oath in 2016 to conceal her conduct.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls, including grooming victims and arranging travel for sexual encounters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims. Deceased at the time of the indictment.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners and closest associates who conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls together.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during their relationship.
Maxwell met, befriended, groomed, and was present for the sexual abuse of this victim, who was approximately 14 years old, by Epstein.
Maxwell interacted with, groomed, and provided an unsolicited topless massage to this minor victim in New Mexico.
Maxwell groomed, befriended, introduced to Epstein, and encouraged to massage Epstein, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused this minor victim, with Maxwell's facilitation, in New York and Florida.
Epstein invited this minor victim to New Mexico for the purpose of grooming and sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused this minor victim during massages that Maxwell encouraged.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls at various locations.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages that led to sexual abuse.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with minors other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition Testimony
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely denied awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and ever giving anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal crimes: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 1997.
Abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.

Maxwell is accused of repeatedly lying under oath during 2016 depositions in civil litigation, specifically denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, interaction with other minors, and her own involvement in massages.
The document is a superseding indictment, indicating it replaces or adds to prior charges, filed in July 2020 by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
